identified-content.person: STACK, LAURA KATHLEEN (LAURA KATHLEEN DE RAMEL)

block.p: Laura Kathleen Stack, a daughter of Katherine Dunn Stack of Newport, R.I., and the late John J. Stack, was married yesterday to Regis Antonin de Ramel, a son of Elizabeth Prince de Ramel of Newport and Count Regis de Ramel of Rivieres, France. The Rev. George McCarthy performed the ceremony at St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church in Newport.

Mrs. de Ramel, 27, is an analyst in Durham, N.C., for the Pechan-Avanti Group, an environmental consulting business. She graduated from Dartmouth College and is to begin studying for an M.B.A. at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill in August. Her mother is a manager at New Visions for Newport County, a Head Start program. Her father retired as a senior marketing representative in Milford, Conn., for I.B.M.

Laura Kathleen Stack, a daughter of Katherine Dunn Stack of Newport, R.I., and the late John J. Stack, was married yesterday to Regis Antonin de Ramel, a son of Elizabeth Prince de Ramel of Newport and Count Regis de Ramel of Rivieres, France. The Rev. George McCarthy performed the ceremony at St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church in Newport.

Mrs. de Ramel, 27, is an analyst in Durham, N.C., for the Pechan-Avanti Group, an environmental consulting business. She graduated from Dartmouth College and is to begin studying for an M.B.A. at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill in August. Her mother is a manager at New Visions for Newport County, a Head Start program. Her father retired as a senior marketing representative in Milford, Conn., for I.B.M.

Mr. de Ramel, 25, is the leasing associate in Durham for CMD Realty Investors, a real estate investment company. He graduated from Washington College in Chestertown, Md. His mother is the editor of Newport This Week, a free weekly publication. His father owns Chateau de Theyrargues, a hotel in Rivieres.
The couple met at Bailey's Beach in Newport in the summer of 1993, when the bride was working there as a lifeguard.
